page.title: 17FARMING,LICKEY/CATSHILL
page.content: {Farms.} There are 10 farms including: Barnsley Hall,Lower Shepley, Yewtree, Firs, Upper Cottage, Woodrow, Beacon and High House farm. The owner of{Lower Shepley Farm}bought the farm in 1961. He only keeps cattle. It costs Â£155 _ Â£160 for one calf. One 13 acre field has been bisected by the M42 motorway into two one_acre triangles. The farm is between 150 to 200 years old. Some of the barns had to be re_built after a fire in 1904. It cost Â£400 to re_build them. Here is some of the machinery he uses: fertilizer spinner, potato digger, mowing machine and plough. He has another field of 11 acres. It costs Â£180 for a ton of minerals for his cattle. This is typical of farms in the area.
